results.title: No turning back (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Depicts the process of training guide dogs for the blind by following the training of Michael Waldock and his dog. In 1984 Michael was awarded the Young Australian of the Year Award for his maning of the emergency coast guard on CB radio.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Closing the Gap
results.creator_credit: Glenn Mack, Les Mack and Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria. Raises issues of concern for those attempting to bridge the gap between schools and the local community. Depicts the first tentative steps of a small inner-city secondary school.
Filmed at the historic, heritage registered building on City Road, Southbank, formerly the J.H. Boyd Girls’ High School, now (2017) known as the ‘Boyd Community Hub’.

results.title: Surrounded: peer group membership
results.brief_description: Looks at the situation of two members of an adolescent group who each for different reasons does not wish to attend a weekend holiday with the others. Shows how they handle the pressure exerted on them by the other members of the group to conform. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: South with Shackleton (1914)
results.creator_credit: Richard Robinson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Follows the trials and tribulations of the unsuccessful exploration team of Sir Ernest Shackleton which set off from South America aboard the “Endurance” to sail to the Antarctic via South Georgia Island. After 9 weeks at sea, the ship was caught by an ice pack and frozen in. Uses archival footage, comments by surviving team members and original film footage taken by Frank Hurley. results.title: Alfred Eisenstaedt
results.creator_credit: Peter Adam and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
Looks at the life and work of former ‘Life’ magazine photographer Alfred Eisenstaedt. Concentrates on portraits of celebrities from 1929 to the present.

results.title: Luchak's Easter
results.creator_credit: Robert Klymasz, National Film Board of Canada and National Museum of Man
results.brief_description: A Ukrainian Easter tradition is celebrated by a Ukrainian-Canadian family in Alberta. Coinciding with the time of Christ’s Resurrection, ceremonies are held in anticipation of the resurrection of those ancestors who have died. The family graveyard is decorated, religious rites are performed, and a family feast is held.
